Description: Three joining sherds of broad conical foot of large Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery open vessel, perhaps a large heavy stemmed bowl or dinos stand; white slip; underside largely reserved with some probably accidental daubs of slip; exterior, from top: guilloche band, maeander band and black band at bottom of foot; on edge of foot band of alternating chequers and crosses (St. Andrew's) in blanks.
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies the sherd as the foot of a dish, but the shape, size and thickness suggest that it is a foot from a substantially large open vessel. Wild Goat Style vases tend to have several bands of patterns. Later Chian vases are more reserved and have fewer bands of patterns.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 270, no. 685)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2036) (phase 2)
